meanings.definition: Opposite of pleasures; things that cause discomfort or displeasure.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise was one of the antipleasures of the party.
meanings.sent2: She avoided horror movies because they were full of antipleasures for her.
meanings.sent3: The rainy weather brought its own antipleasures to the outdoor picnic.
meanings.sent4: The bitter taste of the medicine was an antipleasure she had to endure.
meanings.sent5: The antipleasures of waiting in long lines at the amusement park made the day less enjoyable.

meanings.definition: To experience the opposite of pleasure; to feel discomfort or displeasure.
meanings.sent1: He antipleasures the thought of going to the dentist.
meanings.sent2: They antipleasure the idea of having to work on weekends.
meanings.sent3: She antipleasures having to wake up early on weekends.
meanings.sent4: The cat antipleasures being bathed by its owner.
meanings.sent5: The students antipleasure the idea of having pop quizzes in class.
